required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of NK Combined With Chemotherapy for Advanced Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Natural Killer Cell Combined With Chemotherapy for Advanced Solid Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: Combinations Natural Killer Cell (NK) With chemotherapy treatment may enhance the immune response and stop cancer cells from growing.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients in group A will receive 4 cycles of NK treatments within 8 months. Patients in group B will have no immunotherapy. Chemotherapy are available in both groups.The investigators want to evaluate the efficacy of combination of NK with chemotherapy in patients with treatment-refractory solid tumors

primary_outcome.description: Disease Control Rates (Complete Remission + Partial Remission + Stable Disease), according to solid tumor response evaluation standard (response evaluation criteria in solid tumors, RECIST).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Combination of NK with chemotherapy group
arm_group.description: Patients will receive NK treatments combined with Chemotherapy.

intervention.description: Patients will receive 4 cycles of NK treatments combined with Chemotherapy within 8 months
intervention.arm_group_label: Combination of NK with chemotherapy group
